segments.pli: Saṃyutta Nikāya 21
segments.en: Linked Discourses 21

segments.pli: 1. Bhikkhuvagga
segments.en: 1. Monks

segments.pli: 3. Ghaṭasutta
segments.en: 3. A Mound of Salt

segments.pli: Evaṃ me sutaṃ—
segments.en: So I have heard.

segments.pli: ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
segments.en: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.

segments.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā ca sāriputto āyasmā ca mahāmoggallāno rājagahe viharanti veḷuvane kalandakanivāpe ekavihāre.
segments.en: At that time Venerables Sāriputta and Moggallāna were staying near Rājagaha, in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrels’ feeding ground.

segments.pli: Atha kho āyasmā sāriputto sāyanhasamayaṃ paṭisallānā vuṭṭhito yenāyasmā mahāmoggallāno tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmatā mahāmoggallānena saddhiṃ sammodi.
segments.en: Then in the late afternoon, Venerable Sāriputta came out of retreat, went to Venerable Moggallāna, and exchanged greetings with him.

segments.pli: Sammodanīyaṃ kathaṃ sāraṇīyaṃ vītisāretvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho āyasmā sāriputto āyasmantaṃ mahāmoggallānaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, Sāriputta sat down to one side, and said to Mahāmoggallāna:

segments.pli: “Vippasannāni kho te, āvuso moggallāna, indriyāni;
segments.en: “Reverend Moggallāna, your faculties are so very clear, and your complexion is pure and bright.

segments.pli: parisuddho mukhavaṇṇo pariyodāto santena nūnāyasmā mahāmoggallāno ajja vihārena vihāsī”ti.
segments.en: Have you spent the day in a peaceful meditation?”

segments.pli: “Oḷārikena khvāhaṃ, āvuso, ajja vihārena vihāsiṃ.
segments.en: “Reverend, I’ve spent the day in a coarse meditation.

segments.pli: Api ca me ahosi dhammī kathā”ti.
segments.en: But I have had some Dhamma talk.”

segments.pli: “Kena saddhiṃ panāyasmato mahāmoggallānassa ahosi dhammī kathā”ti?
segments.en: “Who did you have a Dhamma talk with?”

segments.pli: “Bhagavatā kho me, āvuso, saddhiṃ ahosi dhammī kathā”ti.
segments.en: “With the Buddha.”

segments.pli: “Dūre kho, āvuso, bhagavā etarahi sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
segments.en: “But Reverend, the Buddha is far away. He’s staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.

segments.pli: Kiṃ nu kho āyasmā mahāmoggallāno bhagavantaṃ iddhiyā upasaṅkami;
segments.en: Did you go to him with your psychic power,

segments.pli: udāhu bhagavā āyasmantaṃ mahāmoggallānaṃ iddhiyā upasaṅkamī”ti?
segments.en: or did he come to you?”

segments.pli: “Na khvāhaṃ, āvuso, bhagavantaṃ iddhiyā upasaṅkamiṃ;
segments.en: “No reverend, I didn’t go to him with my psychic power,

segments.pli: napi maṃ bhagavā iddhiyā upasaṅkami.
segments.en: nor did he come to me.

segments.pli: Api ca me yāvatā bhagavā ettāvatā dibbacakkhu visujjhi dibbā ca sotadhātu.
segments.en: Rather, the Buddha cleared his clairvoyance and clairaudience towards me,

segments.pli: Bhagavatopi yāvatāhaṃ ettāvatā dibbacakkhu visujjhi dibbā ca sotadhātū”ti.
segments.en: and I cleared my clairvoyance and clairaudience towards him.”

segments.pli: “Yathākathaṃ panāyasmato mahāmoggallānassa bhagavatā saddhiṃ ahosi dhammī kathā”ti?
segments.en: “But what manner of Dhamma talk did you have together?”

segments.pli: “Idhāhaṃ, āvuso, bhagavantaṃ etadavocaṃ:
segments.en: “Well, reverend, I said to the Buddha,

segments.pli: ‘āraddhavīriyo āraddhavīriyoti, bhante, vuccati.
segments.en: ‘Sir, they speak of one who is energetic.

segments.pli: Kittāvatā nu kho, bhante, āraddhavīriyo hotī’ti?
segments.en: How is an energetic person defined?’

segments.pli: Evaṃ vutte, maṃ, āvuso, bhagavā etadavoca:
segments.en: When I said this, the Buddha said,

segments.pli: ‘idha, moggallāna, bhikkhu āraddhavīriyo viharati—
segments.en: ‘Moggallāna, it’s when a mendicant lives with energy roused up:

segments.pli: kāmaṃ taco ca nhāru ca aṭṭhi ca avasissatu, sarīre upassussatu maṃsalohitaṃ, yaṃ taṃ purisathāmena purisavīriyena purisaparakkamena pattabbaṃ na taṃ apāpuṇitvā vīriyassa saṇṭhānaṃ bhavissatīti.
segments.en: “Gladly, let only skin, sinews, and bones remain! Let the flesh and blood waste away in my body! I will not stop trying until I have achieved what is possible by manly strength, energy, and vigor.”

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, moggallāna, āraddhavīriyo hotī’ti.
segments.en: That’s how a person is energetic.’

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho me, āvuso, bhagavatā saddhiṃ ahosi dhammī kathā”ti.
segments.en: That’s the Dhamma talk I had together with the Buddha.”

segments.pli: “Seyyathāpi, āvuso, himavato pabbatarājassa parittā pāsāṇasakkharā yāvadeva upanikkhepanamattāya;
segments.en: “Reverend, next to Venerable Mahāmoggallāna I’m like a few pieces of gravel next to the Himalayas, the king of mountains.

segments.pli: evameva kho mayaṃ āyasmato mahāmoggallānassa yāvadeva upanikkhepanamattāya.
Āyasmā hi mahāmoggallāno mahiddhiko mahānubhāvo ākaṅkhamāno kappaṃ tiṭṭheyyā”ti.
segments.en: Venerable Mahāmoggallāna is so mighty and powerful he could, if he wished, live on for the eon.”

segments.pli: “Seyyathāpi, āvuso, mahatiyā loṇaghaṭāya parittā loṇasakkharāya yāvadeva upanikkhepanamattāya;
segments.en: “Reverend, next to Venerable Sāriputta I’m like a few grains of salt next to a mound of salt.

segments.pli: evameva kho mayaṃ āyasmato sāriputtassa yāvadeva upanikkhepanamattāya.
Āyasmā hi sāriputto bhagavatā anekapariyāyena thomito vaṇṇito pasattho:
segments.en: Venerable Sāriputta has been commended, complimented, and praised by the Buddha:

segments.pli: ‘Sāriputtova paññāya,
segments.en: ‘In wisdom,

segments.pli: sīlena upasamena ca;
segments.en: ethics, and peace,

segments.pli: Yopi pāraṅgato bhikkhu,
segments.en: any mendicant who has crossed over

segments.pli: etāvaparamo siyā’”ti.
segments.en: can at best equal Sāriputta.’”

segments.pli: Itiha te ubho mahānāgā aññamaññassa subhāsitaṃ sulapitaṃ samanumodiṃsūti.
segments.en: And so these two spiritual giants agreed with each others’ fine words.

segments.pli: Tatiyaṃ.

suttaplex.blurb: Sāriputta and Moggallāna come together for a discussion, which touches on the use of psychic powers and energy. The two great monks end up warmly praising each other.
